author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Alagappa University has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the local Galaxy Research Technologies (GRT), a start-up company in the field of polymer-based hollow fibre membrane.

Under this agreement, GRT would establish its research and development unit inside the university campus and share human resources and expertise for developing advanced fibre-fabrication technology which would cater to the big demand existing in the field of purification, filtration and waste management.

“The main objective of the MoU is to provide a forum where the industry and academicians will meet on the campus to share their expertise and to promote their findings into commercial venture,” a release from the university said on Thursday.

The new initiative would facilitate the student community to carry out their projects in a company background and enhance their skills for better employability, it said. The activities of both the institutions would aim at carrying out research projects related to the areas of Physics and Biology, the release said.

“The expertise of GRT in the field of purification, filtration and waste management may be utilised as and when it is required by Alagappa University,” the release said.

V. Balachandran, Registrar in-charge and Dr. V. Swaminathan, Managing Director, GRT signed the MoU on behalf of Alagappa University and GRT respectively in the presence of Prof S. Subbaiah, Vice-Chancellor of Alagappa University and G. Ravi, Dean, Industry and Consultancy.
title: Alagappa University signs MoU with a start-up company
